intro: Silene palinotricha var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-stalked catchfly, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a smooth texture, distinguishing it from other varieties of Silene. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. This plant is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
